title: Is the function f(x) =x+sin x bijective? - Quora

response.answer_text: The function is bijective only in the divided internals of general form [nπ,2nπ]. Where 'n' is any integer But the function x is both injective and surjective in any real domain as it is always an increasing function in the real interval . But the given function f(x) is the sum of the functions x and sinx. So f(x) is a bijective function in the interval. (-oc,oc)Π[nπ,2nπ] So the interval in which the function is a bijective is [nπ,2nπ]. For all n is any natural number.
Yes it is bijective you can check it's graph.
